alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, northeastern Pike and southwestern Hot Spring Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 935 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Amity, or 20 miles northeast of Murfreesboro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Glenwood... Amity... Caddo Valley... Gum Springs in Clark County... Richwoods... DeGray Lake State Park... Bismarck... Alpine... Lower Lake Recreation Area... Rosboro... Hollywood... Point Cedar... De Roche... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southwestern Arkansas.
